You ONLY get banned if you are connected to xbox live everyone. If you burn a game, unplug your internet or simply do not go on xbox live at all. (By that, I mean signing in to any xbox live account) When you put on a game and you're connected, you're sending the game's "mark" or "serial" or whatever you wanna call it to microsoft, and each game has a unique one. A copied game has a copied one so they will know it is an illegal copy. However, if you're completly offline for these copied games, they will never know. LONG STORY SHORT: No internet or online multiplayer = No risk of being banned.
